ANU.name: Jason Payne
ANU.colleges: College of Arts and Social Sciences
interest: Developmental an Life-course criminologyHomicide studiesDrugs and crimeAlcohol and violenceRecidivismDrugs and other specialty courtsCriminal justice evaluationSocial research methodsQuantitative criminology
ANU.biography: Since joining the ANU, Jason has developed and convened a number of teaching programs, including a successful executive training program - Data Analysis in Stata. He has been the successful recipient of a number of research grants and consultancies, including:
project: Prior to his appointment at the ANU, Dr Payne was the Research Manager of the Violent and Serious Crime Monitoring Program (VSCM) at the Australian Institute of Criminology (AIC).  During his 12 years at the AIC, he was Principal or Co-investigator on a number of key research and consultancy projects, including:

A particular highlight of Jason's recent research program has been the coordination and oversight of an evaluation of Aboriginal drug and alcohol treatment programs funded under the National Indigenous Law and Justice Framework. This large, cross jurisdictional research program resulted in a number of key publications, including:
